ygData.subject: Re: Lullaby
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with Tom.  Given all of the other threads that have had at least some acknowledgement on Verant s part, this one certainly deserved one.  At the very
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with Tom. Given all of the other threads that have had at least some
acknowledgement on Verant's part, this one certainly deserved one. At the very
least, an "oh, my, we'll check that out". And while I agree that bumps are
somewhat cheap, they do indicate a serious interest on the part of the readership.

And how else are you supposed to respond if, in fact, you agree fully with what
was said, and have not yet seen a response of any sort from Verant? This
particular thread had 200 responses as of the last time I checked. That in and of
itself should make them pay attention. Too bad it hasn't.

Kenross Cantorforjado, 43 songs, Innoruuk

PS - I'm ashamed to admit it, but I never even tried to use Pixie Strike to mez
extra MOBs until this past weekend. (I know, whip me with a soggy noodle.) Now
that I've tried it, I have one comment: this song stinks, too. I'm in Lower Guk,
we're fighting two froggies, a blue wiz comes through the door. "Don't worry,
I'll mez it", I say. Four Pixies later and no mez, I say "Oh, forget it!" and
proceed to pound him. I'm just glad nobody died. How embarrassing is that? And
that was not an isolated example.



Peck White wrote:
>
> From: Peck White <PWhite@...>
>
> John's hard work and hard data should have elicited a response sans bumps
> IMHO.
>
> Tom
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
> Note: Abashi is perfectly aware of the practice of bumping. He has mentioned
> it before. He does not put more emphasis on things bumped than other things.
> Because he knows that is artificial to get it to the top of the list,
> NOT more discussion/information.
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Peck White <PWhite@...>
> >
> >Well, John's post on the EQ boards concerning Lullaby now has 5+ pages of
> >bumps and has remained at the top of the boards. Yet there has still been
> >no response from Abashi or GZ. It is my hope that they are secretly going
> >to de-nerf it in tomorrow mornings patch without ever admitting that there
> >was a problem. Am I a wild-eyed optimist?
> >
> >Tomerrilin Loreweaver
> >
